Title: Unified Architecture Workspace
Description: Transform ARKHITEKTON into a single source of truth where architects can create, manage, and publish all architecture artifacts without fragmentation across multiple tools. Enables native document creation, @-mention linking, external system integration, and publishing to Confluence/Word/PDF.

Title: Defect Management System - Quality Command Center
Description:
Transform the basic defect tracking feature into a comprehensive Quality Command Center that provides:
- Dedicated defect management module (/plan/quality)
- Advanced filtering, search, and saved presets
- Quality analytics and metrics dashboards
- Architecture-aware defect tracking (UNIQUE DIFFERENTIATOR)
- AI-powered insights and duplicate detection

This epic spans 24 user stories across 5 phases, delivering 140 story points over 9-12 sprints.

**Strategic Value:**
- Competitive moat: Only ALM tool that links defects to enterprise architecture
- Executive visibility: Quality dashboards answer "Are we ready to ship?"
- Proactive quality: Pattern detection prevents recurring issues
- Developer efficiency: Full context in one place (story, test, code, component)

**Documentation:**
- Vision: docs/ARKDL-0012-Defect-Management-Vision.md
- Analysis: docs/Defect-Management-Gap-Analysis.md

**Original Story:** US-AI-AGENT-006 (now references this epic)

Title: Core IDE Framework
Description: VS Code-inspired six-zone layout with Activity Bar, Sidebars, Editor Area, Panel, and Status Bar. Includes multi-tab support, command palette, keyboard shortcuts, and theme customization.

Title: Modeling Canvas Engine
Description: Infinite canvas with pan/zoom, grid snapping, smart guides, drag-drop elements, connection system, undo/redo, multi-selection, and export to PNG/SVG/PDF.

Title: Element Library
Description: 200+ architecture elements (AWS, Azure, GCP, ArchiMate, Generic) with search, filtering, favorites, and recents. Organized by category with drag-drop support.

Title: AI Modeling Agents
Description: Cursor-style AI agents with mode selection (Auto, Question, Strategize, Execute, Scenarios), inline AI (Cmd+K), specialized architects (@SecurityArch, @DataArch, @CloudArch), context awareness, and diff view for changes.

Title: Validation & Quality
Description: Real-time validation engine checking connections, naming, properties, and patterns. Problems panel with errors/warnings/info, and quick fix actions with AI suggestions.

Title: Wiki Page Management
Description: Provide full CRUD operations for wiki pages with proper persistence and user management. Architects can create, read, update, and delete wiki pages to document their architecture.

Title: Block-Based Editor
Description: Implement TipTap block-based editor with markdown shortcuts and slash commands. Architects get a modern, rich editing experience similar to Notion/Confluence.

Title: Tree View & Navigation
Description: Provide hierarchical navigation for wiki pages with tree view sidebar. Architects can organize and navigate their documentation in a logical hierarchy.

Title: Backlinks & References
Description: Show where each entity is mentioned across the wiki. Architects can discover all documentation that references a specific component or decision.

Title: Requirements Management
Description: Treat requirements as first-class wiki pages with structured metadata. Architects can write requirements that are both narrative and traceable.

Title: Traceability Matrix
Description: Auto-generate traceability showing requirement → component → story mappings. Architects can prove requirements are met and find gaps.

Title: Page Templates
Description: Provide pre-built templates for common documentation types. Architects can start with proven structures instead of blank pages.

Title: Collaboration Features
Description: Enable real-time collaboration like Google Docs. Multiple architects can work on the same document simultaneously.

Title: Version History
Description: Provide Git-like version control for wiki pages. Architects can see changes over time and restore previous versions.

Title: Semantic Mentions System
Description:
Implement platform-wide @mention system that creates live links to entities across the entire ARKHITEKTON application. This enables architects to create semantic connections between documentation and actual architecture artifacts, forming a living knowledge graph.
      
Key Features:
- Type @ to trigger entity picker
- Search across all entity types (stories, epics, defects, models, objects, applications, capabilities, pages)
- Status-aware rendering (green=active, orange=deprecated, red=sunset)
- Hover preview cards with entity details
- Click to navigate to entity
- Backlinks panel showing where entities are mentioned

Title: Portfolio Management System
Description:
Enterprise Portfolio Management module consolidating Application Portfolio Management (APM/CMDB) 
with Strategic Initiative tracking and Dependency visualization.

**Business Value:**
- Single source of truth for application inventory and strategic programs
- Enable data-driven investment decisions through initiative analytics
- Reduce risk through dependency and impact analysis
- Improve governance with approval workflows and audit trails

**Key Capabilities:**
- Applications: CMDB-style inventory with lifecycle, costs, and technology stack
- Initiatives: Strategic program tracking with budgets, milestones, and KPIs
- Dependencies: Cross-reference matrix showing initiative-application relationships

**Target Users:**
- Enterprise Architects
- Portfolio Managers
- Program Managers
- Technology Owners
- Executive Leadership

Title: Word-Style Rich Text Formatting Toolbar

Title: Sprint 1: The Fix
Description: Revive Kanban board and add agile estimation fields

Title: Create Unified Objects Table Schema
Description: Create the unified_objects table that will store all architecture artifacts (shapes, diagrams, ADRs, requirements, documents, uploads, external references) with a common schema enabling universal search and traceability.

Title: Create Object References Table
Description: Create the object_references table to track all relationships between objects, enabling @-mentions, traceability, and backlinks. Supports relationship types: mention, embed, trace, implements, depends_on, derives_from.

Title: Migrate Canvas Models from localStorage to Database
Description: Create models table and API endpoints to persist canvas state, replacing localStorage with database storage. Enables sharing, versioning, and collaboration on architecture diagrams.

Title: Content Editor Foundation (TipTap Integration)
Description: Integrate TipTap rich text editor as the foundation for architecture document creation. Supports headings, formatting, lists, links, code blocks with ARKHITEKTON theme styling.

Title: Document CRUD UI
Description: Create UI for creating, reading, updating, and deleting architecture documents. Includes document type selection (ADR, Design Spec, Technical Brief, etc.), search, filtering, and status management.

Title: Seed AWS Cloud Shapes as Objects
Description: Create seeding script to import all 120 AWS cloud icons from /client/public/icons/cloud/aws/ into unified_objects table with proper metadata (vendor, framework, category, SVG path).

Title: Seed Azure, GCP, IBM Shapes
Description: Extend seeding script to import Azure (100), GCP (45), and IBM (50) cloud icons into unified_objects table. Total 315 cloud vendor shapes available.

Title: TOGAF Shape Definitions
Description: Define and seed TOGAF framework shapes (30+ shapes): ABB, SBB, Actor, Role, Function, Process, Data Entity, Application Component.

Title: Object Search API with Filters
Description: Create API endpoint for searching and filtering unified objects across all types. Supports full-text search, type filters, vendor filters, pagination, and relevance ranking.

Title: Object Library Page UI
Description: Create unified object library page where users can browse, search, and filter all architecture objects (shapes, diagrams, documents, etc.) with grid view, cards, and detail modals.

Title: Object Detail Modal
Description: Create modal that displays full details of any object, including metadata, relationships, usage information, and action buttons (Edit, Use in Canvas, Copy, etc.).

Title: ArchiMate Shape Definitions
Description: Define and seed core ArchiMate 3.2 shapes (50+ shapes) organized by layer: Business, Application, Technology, Strategy, Physical, Implementation, Motivation.

Title: @-Mention Parser & Resolution API
Description: Create parser to detect @-mentions in rich text and API to resolve them to actual objects with preview data. Response time must be <100ms for good UX.

Title: Backlink Computation System
Description: Implement system to automatically compute and update backlinks when references are created or deleted. Uses database triggers or async jobs for performance.

Title: Unified Search with Ranking
Description: Enhance search API with relevance ranking (exact match > description > tags > content), popularity boost from referenceCount, and highlighted snippets.

Title: @-Mention Autocomplete in Editor
Description: Integrate @-mention autocomplete into TipTap editor with real-time suggestions, keyboard navigation, and preview cards on hover.

Title: Object Preview Card Component
Description: Create reusable preview card component that shows object details on hover over @-mentions. Displays different content based on object type.

Title: Diagram Embedding in Editor
Description: Enable embedding canvas diagrams as content blocks in documents (not attachments). Diagrams appear inline with preview, click to open editor modal.

Title: Document Templates
Description: Create document templates for common architecture artifacts: ADR, Design Spec, Technical Brief, Reference Architecture, Capability Assessment. Pre-populated with structure and guidance.

Title: Document Version History UI
Description: Add version history tracking and UI to view/restore previous versions. Auto-save creates versions. Show timeline, preview versions, restore, compare diffs.

Title: Document Publishing Workflow UI
Description: Add workflow UI for document status transitions: Draft → In Review → Approved → Published → Archived. Status badges, permissions, notifications.

Title: Document Versioning API
Description: Create API endpoints for document version management: create version on save, list versions, retrieve specific version, restore version.

Title: Customer Input Objects API
Description: Create API for storing customer inputs (requirements, feedback, constraints) as unified objects with sourceSystem='customer', enabling linking to deliverables.

Title: BPMN Shape Definitions
Description: Define and seed BPMN 2.0 shapes (25+ shapes) for business process modeling: Task, Gateway, Event, Pool, Lane, Data Object.

Description: Implement Jira API integration to import stories/epics as requirement objects. Configure connection, fetch issues, create as unified objects with sourceSystem='jira', sync updates.

Description: Create API to analyze impact of changes to an object. Return direct and indirect impact, total count, impact by type, severity levels based on object status.

Title: Traceability Graph Visualization
Description: Create interactive graph visualization showing traceability relationships. Uses React Flow or D3.js with force-directed layout, zoom/pan, filtering by type and depth.

Title: Publishing Status Indicator
Description: Add visual indicators showing where documents have been published (Confluence, PDF). Badges on document cards, hover shows last published date, click opens target.

Title: Defect Management System - Foundation (See EPIC-DEFECT for full roadmap)
Description:
As a QA Agent, I want a comprehensive defect management system so that quality issues are tracked, analyzed, and resolved systematically.

**⚠️ NOTE: This story is now part of a larger initiative.**

This story represents the original foundation work. The complete Defect Management System is being implemented across 24 user stories in 5 phases:

**Phase 1 - Foundation (Sprints 1-2): 15 points**
- US-DEFECT-001: Defect List View
- US-DEFECT-002: Defect Detail Page
- US-DEFECT-003: Advanced Filtering
- US-DEFECT-004: Defect Export (PDF/CSV)

**Phase 2 - Lifecycle (Sprints 3-4): 17 points**
- US-DEFECT-005: Triage Queue
- US-DEFECT-006: Verification Workflow
- US-DEFECT-007: Defect Templates
- US-DEFECT-008: Rejection Reasons
- US-DEFECT-009: Duplicate Detection

**Phase 3 - Analytics (Sprints 5-6): 29 points**
- US-DEFECT-010: Quality Dashboard
- US-DEFECT-011: Defect Trend Analysis
- US-DEFECT-012: Component Heatmap
- US-DEFECT-013: Defect Aging Report
- US-DEFECT-014: Quality Gates

**Phase 4 - Intelligent Linking (Sprints 7-8): 29 points**
- US-DEFECT-015: Test Case Linking
- US-DEFECT-016: Architecture Component Linking (UNIQUE DIFFERENTIATOR)
- US-DEFECT-017: Source Code Linking
- US-DEFECT-018: Release Version Tagging
- US-DEFECT-019: Auto-Defect from Failed Tests

**Phase 5 - AI Enhancement (Sprints 9+): 42 points**
- US-DEFECT-020: AI Duplicate Detection
- US-DEFECT-021: Root Cause Library
- US-DEFECT-022: AI Severity Suggestion
- US-DEFECT-023: Defect Pattern Recognition
- US-DEFECT-024: Predictive Defect Analytics

**Total Effort:** 140 story points across 24 stories

**See Also:**
- docs/ARKDL-0012-Defect-Management-Vision.md (Complete Product Vision)
- docs/Defect-Management-Gap-Analysis.md (Research & Competitive Analysis)

**Current Implementation Status:**
The existing DefectManagement component provides basic CRUD and story-blocking logic. This is the MVF (Minimum Viable Feature). The roadmap above transforms it into a true Quality Command Center.

Title: DEF-003: StoryDetailSheet crashes with epics.find is not a function
Description:
When clicking on a story card in the Kanban board (/plan/board), the StoryDetailSheet component crashes with a runtime error: epics.find is not a function. This occurs because the /api/epics endpoint returns { data: [], total: N } but the code was treating the response as a direct array.

Root Cause: Incorrect type assumption for useQuery response.
Fix: Extract epics from epicsResponse?.data || []

Title: DEF-004: Enhancement metadata embedded in description instead of using structured fields
Description:
When creating enhancement stories, the Enhances, Enhancement Type, and Rationale values are being embedded in the description field as markdown text (e.g. **Enhances:** US-XXX) instead of using the new structured database fields (enhances, enhancementType, rationale) that were added in US-WW9SP8C.

This defeats the purpose of having structured, queryable fields for traceability.

Expected: Use the enhances[], enhancementType, and rationale columns
Actual: Values embedded in description text
